intro: Zauschneria californica subsp. typica, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to reddish-orange petals. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and coastal bluffs. Its flowers are showy and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The subspecies typica is distinguished by its slightly smaller and more elongated petals compared to other subspecies.
